course_title: Special Topics in History: Passings in American History
class_notes:
This class meets on Wednesdays 4:20 pm - 7:15 pm.


(What does it mean for people to transform themselves in a society devoted to both self-improvement and authenticity, reinvention and sincerity? When is acquiring a new identity permissible and commendable? When is it dangerous and subversive? Who decides? Have some shiftings: perhaps social and economic? "been taken as more legitimate than others" say across racial, ethnic, and gender thresholds? Why? 
Under the broad flag of 'passing,' this seminar will explore such questions as they unfolded in America from colonial times to roughly the present. Materials for the course will include primary and secondary sources, fiction and non-fiction, texts, images, and films.)
